title: Your First Plot
text:
Instructions:
Be patient when running a coding exercise for the first time, it can take a few minutes.
When you see ____ in a coding exercise, replace it with what you assume to be the correct code. Run the code to see if you obtain the desired output and submit it to validate if you were correct.
Let’s use the same vehicle dataset we saw in the lecture, but visualize the relationship between two different columns.
The data has already been imported for you in this exercise.
Here is what it looks like:








Tasks:

Fill out the missing fields in the Altair plot in order to create a scatter plot.
The cars’ Horsepower should be on the y-axis and their Weight_in_lbs on the x-axis.
Color the points by the Origin of the cars.
















Hint 1





Consider using the filter() function from dplyr.











Fully worked solution:





Use the filter() function from dplyr:









Take the starwars dataset, and then,
Filter for the “Droid” species.

title: Data Visualization
text:
Question 1 Which function do we need to use to superimpose plots in Altair?

Overlay
Layer
Panel







Answer





The correct answer is “Layer”.



Question 2 Line plots are often preferable to point plots when visualizing trends over time because…

The lines make the plot more visually appealing.
Line plots are faster to create.
The line makes it easy to see which values are connected in the same group and its slope facilitates our interpretation of the overall trend.







Answer





The answer choice “c” is correct. Exlanation for the incorrect answer choices: - “The lines make the plot more visually appealing.”: There is more to plots then just being visually appealing. - “Line plots are faster to create.”: They both take approximately the same time to create..
crumbs: Questions on How Plots are Created

title: Data Visualization
text:
True or False A low-level visualization library focuses on plot construction details.

True
False







Answer





The right answer is “True”. If you got this wrong, you may have confused it with high-level visualization.



True or False A high-level visualization library focuses on data and relationships.

True
False







Answer





The right answer is “True”.

title: Data Visualization
text:
True or False It is easier for humans to interpret plots than raw numbers.

True
False







Answer





The right answer is “True”: We saw in the slides that sometimes humans can pick up more information about the data in plots. If you got this wrong: Take a look at the slides. Is it easier to notice trends and patterns with the data displayed in tables or in plots?



True or False Statistical summaries are often useful, but it is a good idea to also visualize your data before drawing any conclusions.

True
False







Answer





The right answer is “True”. If you got this wrong: Summaries are helpful but don’t get us a full picture like a visualization can.
crumbs: True or False: Data Visualization V1

title: Data Visualization
text:
Have you taken the prerequisite Programming in Python for Data Science?

Yes I have and I am ready to take Data Visualization.
I have not taken the prerequisite but I’m feeling confident that I know python well enough.
I have not and I have little Python coding background.







Answer





To proceed with Module 1 of the “Data Visualization” course, you must first complete the “Programming in Python for Data Science” course as a prerequisite.

title: Data Visualization
text:
Question 1 What is another way of describing high-level visualization libraries?

Imperative
Declarative
Immediate
Definitive







Answer





The correct answer is “Declarative”. - “Imperative” refers to low-level plotting. - “Immediate” and “Definitive” are also incorrect choices—we included them as distractors.



Question 2 What kind of components are combined in declarative plotting to create visualizations?

Dictionary Keys
Block Components
Grammatical Components
Grouping Components







Answer





The correct answer is “Grammatical Components”. Exlanation for the incorrect answer choices: - “Dictionary Keys”: This refers to a data structure, not a plotting structure. - “Block Components”: Consider a more language-oriented approach. - “Grouping Components”: This term doesn’t have a clear definition—we made it up!
